intro.description: Using the tools in the diffraction viewer it is possible to calibrate the detector distance using the tools avaliable in the diffraction viewer.

item.title: Calibrant
item.description: Choosing the calibrant There are a number of pre-entered calibrants entered in the preferences associated with the diffraction viewer. These are Cr2O3, silicon and bee's wax.

subitem.label: These can be found by opening the preferences window by 'Window' -> 'Preferences' from the menu. Searching for 'Diffraction Viewer' to bring up the correct window.
To add a custom calibrant enter the name and the d spacing speterated by commas and press add. Once the new calibrant is added select it from the list and click OK.

item.title: Showing the Calibrant
item.description: The Calibrant can be seen by toggling the button marked 'Calibrant' after checking the toggle ring box. It is also useful to show the beam centre as well.

item.title: Manipulating the detector position
item.description: To manipulate the detector position return to the 'Image Metadata' tab where the cross of buttons allows the beam centre to be moved around. It is also possible to enter the information into the relavant fields.

subitem.label: There detector distance can also be manipulated along with the wavelength.

It is also possible to edit the beam position by clicking on the detector. To do this first make the beam centre visible and then, with the plot view selected, hold 'Shift' and left click on the image where the beam centre should be. The beam centre will move to the position of the click.
